title: Ultra Laser Reflection System
description: This plugin offers 3 methods for collision traces along reflective lines, with flexible customization. Ideal for laser weapons, puzzles, and other reflective line tracing needs.
longDescription:
This plugin offers three methods for performing collision traces along a reflective line: by channel, by profile, or for objects.


It returns each hit encountered and allows for flexible customization of parameters, including but not limited to line length and reflection offset angle.


This plugin is highly versatile and useful for laser weapons, laser puzzles, and any other scenes that require reflective line tracing.


  • Scatter Blaster, Scatter Reflection Laser Weapon [Video]

All these assets in videos below are also provided in the plugin,

  • Reflective laser with this plugin [Video]
  • Reflective Laser System with customizable parameters [Vidoe]
  • Reflective line trace for objects and by profile [Video]


My other Asset Packs:

  • [UMG Typewriter Effect Pro]
  • [Grenade System Pro]
  • [Interactive Fireworks Firecrackers Pack]
  • [Grenade System Lite]
technicalDetails:
Features:

  • Easy drag-and-drop functionality
  • Three methods for reflective line tracing: by channel, by profile, and for objects
  • Simple customization options
  • Flexible parameters, including but not limited to line length, reflection offset angle and beam segment thickness.
  • Demo Blueprint and FX assets included


Number of Blueprints: 3

Niagara system: 1

Material: 3


Supported Development Platforms:

Windows: Yes

Mac: Untested

Very Important Information:

  • Before running the project, please ensure that the Niagara Plugin is enabled for earlier engine versions, such as 4.23, to avoid errors. If particles in the example do not disappear correctly, this is due to a Niagara version issue and is not a bug with this asset.
  • To fix this issue: Enter the Niagara editor for the laser FX, Select the red exclamation mark and click the ‘Fix Issue’ button. Then change the inactive response to ‘Kill’.
